title: Trump’s Withering Criticism of Powell Puts Fed Decisions Under Microscope
summary: The central bank is poised to hold interest rates steady this month, but there could be a path to cut as early as September.

summary: The National Capital Planning Commission has become pivotal in the administration’s campaign to discredit Jerome H. Powell, the chairman of the Federal Reserve.

title: NPR and PBS Face Federal Funding Cuts: What to Know
summary: Cutting funding from the Corporation for Public Broadcasting could be catastrophic for local stations, particularly those in rural areas.

summary: The cuts speak to President Trump’s grip on his party but also to the sweeping changes in media.

title: House Republicans Dangle Possible Vote on Epstein Files, After Voter Backlash

summary: Donald Trump was friendly for at least 15 years with Jeffrey Epstein, the multimillionaire financier and convicted sex offender who died in prison in 2019.

title: Why Is Stephen Colbert’s ‘Late Show’ Getting Canceled?
summary: Maybe the “Late Show” decision is purely financial. But after Paramount’s cave over “60 Minutes,” it is hard to trust.

title: Truemed, a Start-Up Run by an RFK. Jr. Aide, Gives Tax Breaks for Meat and Mattresses
summary: The start-up, called Truemed, helps people buy meat and mattresses with money that isn’t subject to federal income tax. But does the tax break apply?

title: Bolsonaro, Brazil’s Former President, Ordered to Wear Ankle Monitor Before Trial
summary: Brazil’s Supreme Court ordered Jair Bolsonaro, the former president, to stay home most hours, defying President Trump’s demands that charges against him be dropped.

summary: The condition, which can cause swelling and pain, is common among older adults.

summary: The leaders of France, Germany and Britain are building parallel diplomatic institutions to defend Europe as President Trump retreats from the continent.

summary: Offering a rare glimpse inside the hidden world of rejected insurance claims, new data shows a steady uptick among major private insurers.

title: How a Video Studio Embraced A.I. and Stormed the Internet
summary: The Dor Brothers are indie filmmakers whose viral videos are generated entirely by artificial intelligence.

summary: Recent comments by the Israeli prime minister and a Fox News commentator about Cheltenham High School, their alma mater in suburban Philadelphia, have inflamed a debate.

summary: Spread across Syria, Lebanon and Israel, the secretive religious minority has long balanced integration and independence. Now, members are at the heart of the region’s shifting power struggles.

summary: President Trump’s plan to impose a 100 percent tariff on Russian goods could raise the cost of urea, a key fertilizer in corn and other row crops.

summary: President Trump’s attacks on the group of emerging economies, which includes Brazil, Russia and China, have put one member — India — in an uncomfortable spot.

summary: Nicknamed “Fearless Felix,” he jumped from the edge of space in 2012.

summary: It was not immediately clear what caused the blast at the Los Angeles County Sheriff’s Department’s Biscailuz Training Academy center.

title: Chevron Buys Hess After Beating Exxon in Dispute Over One of World’s Hottest Oil Projects
summary: Chevron completed its purchase of Hess after prevailing in a legal dispute with Exxon over one of the most promising oil projects in the world.

title: What to Know About the TSA’s Possible End to Its Liquid Size Limits
